parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To ask, request, petition, demand. Of uncertain derivation; to ask.
A tablet for writing. Diminutive of pinax; a tablet.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) intrans: I wonder, marvel, (b) trans: I wonder at, admire. From thauma; to wonder; by implication, to admire.
